A Binary_assembly_constraint is a type of and of controlling the relationship between precisely two constituents in an assembly. It specifies a binary relationship between just two geometric elements. Only directed cases are allowed. Any instance of an Binary_assembly_constraint is specified between exactly two pairs of and to guarantee that it is a constraint between two different constituents. The precise nature of the geometric relationship is defined by the subtypes.

A Coaxial_assembly_constraint is a type of and of specifying that the axes of two elements belonging to different constituents are constrained to be identical. The constraint is valid for points, lines, circles, surfaces and solids having an axis of rotational symmetry.
A Dimensioned_angle_assembly_constraint is a type of and of . It specifies that an instance specified by is constrained to make a specified angle with a given instance specified by . The two elements concerned shall belong to different constituents. The actual angle value is an attribute of the supertype .
A Dimensioned_parallel_assembly_constraint is a type of and of that is used for constraining distances between two parallel instances. The shall be either a line or a plane. The actual distance value is an attribute of the supertype .
A Dimensioned_surface_distance_assembly_constraint is a type of and of that constrains the minimum distance between two surfaces belonging to different constituents. The actual distance value is an attribute of the supertype . The optional attribute of the supertype may be used to provide approximate locations of the closest points on each surface in cases where multiple solutions of this constraint may arise. This constraint does not exclude the case when two surfaces specified are both planes. However, it is appropriate to use when two planes are parallel.
A Fixed_constituent_assembly_constraint is a type of that constrains specified constituent of an assembly to be fixed in space.
This constraint asserts that one constituent shape model instance has a fixed position and orientation with regard to the context of the highest level constituent, namely assembly root, to anchor the assembly in space. Without its use, assembly constraint equations may have infinitely many solutions due to the existence of translational and rotational degrees of freedom of the entire assembly. The implication of the constraint is that at the time of data transfer, the sending system constrained the specified constituent as fixed for solving assembly constraint equations. The receiving system, after knowing this fact, may substitute the constituent to be fixed for checking various design alternatives.
An instance of representing the product definition of the constituent to be fixed shall be specified. A instance, which corresponds to the geometric entity picked from a screen by the user for identifying fixed constituent, shall be be included in the instance.

An Incidence_assembly_constraint is a type of and of It specifies that two instances of belonging to different constituents have a relationship such that, one of them, regarded as a point set, is entirely included in the other. Complete coincidence of the two instances is a special case of inclusion.
If two unbounded lines are constrained to be incident, they must have the same or opposite directions, and each line must include the defining point of the other. In this case the two point sets completely coincide. If one of the lines is trimmed but the other is unbounded then the first point set is a subset of the second.
In some cases the use of a dimensional constraint with zero dimension value is more appropriate than the use of an Incidence_assembly_constraint. The mating of planar surfaces of two parts in an assembly may be taken as an example. Control of the distance between two parts in an assembly is a typical assembly design requirement and mating can be regarded as its special case, where the distance value is zero. Therefore, engineers will prefer the use of with zero dimension for representing the mate relation between two parts as it allows the imposition of an additional constraint on the relative orientations of the planes concerned.

A Parallel_assembly_constraint is a type of and of specifying that two instances, each belonging to different constituents, are constrained to be parallel.
A Perpendicular_assembly_constraint is a type of and of specifying that two instances belonging to different constituents be constrained to be mutually perpendicular. The shall be either a line or a plane.
A Tangent_assembly_constraint is a type of and of specifying that two instances, each belonging to different constituents, are constrained to be tangential.
